name: Pork Roast with Herb Rub
author: Colin Wallis
summary: This is a great savory pork roast that is excellent when paired with a sweet squash dish, greens, and Jasmine rice.  Pair with your favorite Chardonnay. Cut into 3/8-inch slices, serve over rice, and don't forget to pour drippings over the pork and rice. Absolutely delicious. You can use any white wine in place of the Chardonnay.
ingredients: ⅓ cup dry white wine (such as Chardonnay)
1 tablespoon honey, or more to taste
directions: Whisk salt, garlic powder, celery salt, ginger, mustard, black pepper, basil, oregano, and thyme together in a small bowl
Cut 1/4-inch deep slits in the fat-side of the roast about 1 1/2-inches apart
Rub spice mixture all over prepared roast to cover completely
Place roast in a slow cooker, pour wine over the top and drizzle with honey
Cook on High until tender, 3 to 4 hours
